meanings.definition: A Chinese puzzle made up of a square divided into seven pieces that can be arranged to make various shapes.
meanings.sent1: Children enjoy solving tangrams to create different pictures.
meanings.sent2: She used tangrams to form a perfect square during the puzzle challenge.
meanings.sent3: The teacher accidentally mixed up the tangrams and created a funny monster shape.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity with tangrams was like painting with geometric pieces.
meanings.sent5: The tangrams in the box were colorful and intriguing to the students.

meanings.definition: A set of seven geometric shapes used in a tangram puzzle.
meanings.sent1: The tangrams set included triangles, squares, and a parallelogram.
meanings.sent2: He arranged the tangrams to form a bird shape on the table.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocked over the tangrams, scattering them all over the floor.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a collection of tangrams waiting to be pieced together.
meanings.sent5: The tangrams puzzle required careful manipulation of the shapes to fit perfectly.
